intro: Cakile baltica, commonly known as Baltic sandspurry, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the coastal regions of the Baltic Sea. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant has small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes and coastal areas. Cakile baltica is adapted to harsh maritime conditions and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
